pwa.util

Class CmdCompletionChecker

  • java.lang.Object
    • pwa.util.CmdCompletionChecker

  • public class CmdCompletionChecker
extends java.lang.Object

    Personal Web Application (PWA) Command Completion Checker

    This class provides a variety of waiting for the command execution.

    For example: 
     
	cmdWin.setLogFlag(true); 
	cmdWin.executeCommand("A_5_SEC_RUNNING_COMMAND");
	cmdChecker.waitForCommandDone(5); //wait at least 5 seconds
	List<String>results = cmdWin.getCommandResult();
	cmdWin.setLogFlag(false);
    See Also:
    CmdWinController

      • waitByFileExistence

        public java.lang.String waitByFileExistence(java.lang.String fileName,
                                            java.lang.String extension,
                                            int duration)
                                     throws java.lang.Exception
        Wait until when a specified file is created or found. The fileName can be a part of characters from the beginning and with the file extension, the latest file will be identified. It is used when a file name consists of fixed characters at the beginning + date/time info.
        Parameters:
        fileName - file name with path
        extension - for example ".log" or "log"; ".txt" or "txt", etc.
        duration - in seconds
        Returns:
        file name identified
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • waitByFileExistence

        public void waitByFileExistence(java.lang.String fileName,
                                int duration)
                         throws java.lang.Exception
        If the specified file does not exist, it will wait until it is created.
        Parameters:
        fileName - file name with path
        duration - wait time to check the file existence repeatedly
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • waitByFileExistenceWithMaxDuration

        public boolean waitByFileExistenceWithMaxDuration(java.lang.String fileName,
                                                  int duration,
                                                  int maxDuration)
                                           throws java.lang.Exception
        It will wait until the specified single content exists, but if the duration becomes larger than maxDuration, it will return false.
        Parameters:
        fileName - file name with path
        duration - duration in seconds
        maxDuration - maximum duration in seconds
        Returns:
        true for file found, false for max-out duration.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • waitByDuration

        public void waitByDuration(java.lang.String fileName,
                           int duration)
                    throws java.lang.Exception
        Wait for the current processing in specified duration in seconds. If the specified log file is not updated during the duration, it stops waiting and return.
        Parameters:
        fileName - file name with path to check its content.
        duration - duration in seconds
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • waitByDuration

        public void waitByDuration(java.lang.String fileName)
                    throws java.lang.Exception
        Wait for the current processing in one second. If the specified file is not updated during the duration, then it stops waiting and returns.
        Parameters:
        fileName - file name with path
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • waitForCommandDone

        public void waitForCommandDone()
                        throws java.lang.Exception
        Wait for the current processing in one second. If the temporary file from CmdWinController is not updated during the duration, it stops waiting and returns.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • waitForCommandDone

        public void waitForCommandDone(int duration)
                        throws java.lang.Exception
        When a command is being executed, it usually write logs. This method checks the length of the log between before and after of "wait time". If the after length is larger than before length, which means the command is still running, it means the command has finished yet. If both become the same length, it means the command is done.
        Parameters:
        duration - duration in seconds
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
